title: Britain's Raab: we have the numbers to pass a Brexit deal
text:
LONDON, Oct 20 (Reuters) - British Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab said the government seemed to have the numbers in the House of Commons to pass Prime Minister Boris Johnson's Brexit deal.

Raab said he was confident the United Kingdom would leave the EU on Oct. 31. He also said parliament could not muzzle the prime minister and that many people in the EU were deeply uncomfortable about further delay.

"He has got that deal. We seem to have the numbers in the House of Commons. Why hasn't parliament pushed this through? that is what we are going to do next week," he told BBC television. (Reporting by Kylie MacLellan and Paul Sandle; editing by Guy Faulconbridge)
description: British Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab said the government seemed to have the numbers in the House of Commons to pass Prime Minister Boris Johnson's Brexit deal.  Raab said he was confident the United Kingdom would leave the EU on Oct. 31.
